parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject experienced any medical conditions or events. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not there was any medical history to report.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Medical History Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: MHYN
fields.questionText: Were any medical conditions or events reported?; Has the subject had any medical conditions or events?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHCAT

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology (e.g., CARDIAC, GENERAL). This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. This would be used when specific medical history (e.g., disease under study details) is captured, in addition to the general medical history.
fields.label: Category for Medical History
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the medical history?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the MHCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Typically would be used when specific medical history (e.g., disease diagnosis) is captured, in addition to the general medical history. MHSCAT can only be used if there is an MHCAT and it must be a subcategorization of MHCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Medical History Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the medical history?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date on which the Medical History was collected using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date on which the medical history was collected represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: This should be a complete date. The date of collection may be determined from a collected visit date.
fields.label: Date of Medical History Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MHDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the medical history was collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications and/or procedure records with MH. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system. If CMMHNO or PRMHNO is used, this is the identifier to which CMMHNO or PRMHNO refers.
fields.label: Medical History Event Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MHSPID
fields.questionText: What is the medical condition or event identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHEVDTYP

fields.completionInstructions: The instructions depend upon the format of the CRF. Sponsors may pre-print these values on the CRF or use them as defaulted or hidden text.
fields.definition: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or the MHENDTC is defined.
fields.implementationNotes: The type of start/ and or end date (e.g., DIAGNOSIS, SYMPTOMS, RELAPSE, INFECTION). It is not related to the trial's condition. This date type cannot be a PRIMARY DIAGNOSIS, SECONDARY DIAGNOSIS since these terms do not define the date type.
fields.label: Medical History Event Date Type
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMH dataset as the value of SUPPMH.QVAL when SUPPMH.QNAM = "MHEVDTYP" and SUPPMH.QLABEL= "Medical History Event Date Type". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: MHEVDTYP
fields.questionText: What was the medical history event date type?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHTERM

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Medical History

fields.completionInstructions: Record all relevant medical conditions or events, as defined in the protocol. Record only one medical condition or event per line. Ensure that the medical conditions or events listed on the Medical History page do not meet any of the exclusion criteria.
fields.definition: The reported or pre-specified name of the medical condition or event.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors should collect all relevant medical conditions or events, as defined in the protocol. It is a best practice for sponsors to collect all relevant history of surgeries or procedures using the associated diagnosis in the MH domain, while reporting relevant surgeries and procedures in the SDTM PR domain. Sponsor should provide instructions on how surgeries and procedures will be handled based on the protocol requirements. Information on pre-specified surgeries, or procedures should be collected in the PR domain.
fields.label: Medical History Event Reported Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHTERM
fields.questionText: What is the medical condition or event term?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHOCCUR

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if [specific medical condition/event] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication whether a pre-specified medical condition/event or a group of medical conditions/events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: MHOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specified medical conditions or events. MHOCCUR is not used if the medical conditions or events are collected on the CRF in a manner that requires spontaneously free-text response. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Medical History Event Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHOCCUR
fields.questionText: Did the subject have [pre-specified medical condition/event/group of medical conditions]; Is the [pre-specified medical occurring ]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHPRESP

fields.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are pre-specified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to Y, or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation when the medical condition or event is pre-specified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified medical history as well as free-text events, the value of MHPRESP should be Y for all pre-specified events and null for medical conditions or events reported as free-text. MHPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
fields.label: Medical History Event Pre-Specified
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHPRESP
fields.questionText: N/A

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHPRIOR

fields.completionInstructions: Check if the medical condition or event started [before the study].
fields.definition: An indication whether the event occurred prior to study start.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors may collect this information rather than start dates. See section 2.1.3 Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and SDTMIG IG 3.2 section 4.1.4.7 for more information.
fields.label: Prior Medical History Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as MHSTRF or MHSTRTPT. When populating MHSTRF, or MHSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field MHPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When MHPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable MHSTRF should be populated. When MHPRIOR is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables MHSTRTPT and MHSTTPT should be used. Note: MHSTRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in MHSTTPT.
fields.name: MHPRIOR
fields.questionText: Did the medical condition or event start prior to [MHSTTPT]?; Did the medical condition or event start prior to study start?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record the medical condition or event as ongoing ("Y") if it has not ended at the time of data collection and the end date should be left blank.
fields.definition: Indication the medical condition or event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the condition has not resolved at the time of data collection. It is expected that every reported condition has either an End Date or the Ongoing field is populated, but not both. See CDASHIG Section on Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and the SDTMIG for more information. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
fields.label: Ongoing Medical History Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as MHENRF or MHENRTPT. When populating MHENRF, if the value of MHONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating MHENRTPT, if the value of MHONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When MHONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable MHENRF should be populated. When MHONGO is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables MHENRTPT and MHENTPT should be used. Note: MHENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in MHENTPT.
fields.name: MHONGO
fields.questionText: Is the medical condition or event ongoing?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHCTRL

self.title: Medical History Disease or Symptom Under Control

fields.definition: Indication whether the medical condition or event is under control at the time of data collection.
fields.implementationNotes: MHCTRL is not defined in the SDTMIG MH domain. If collected, it should be submitted in the SUPPMH dataset. If MHCTRL is collected, the sponsor must provide information on the relative timeframe. Generally, MHDAT is collected or determined using the visit date of the collection to indicate this is the subject's status at the time of data collection.
fields.label: Medical History Disease or Symptom Under Control
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMH dataset as the value of SUPPMH.QVAL where SUPPMH.QNAM ="MHCTRL" and SUPPMH.LABEL="Medical Condition Under Control". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: MHCTRL
fields.questionText: Is the medical condition or event under control?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHSTDAT

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Start Date/Time of Medical History Event

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the medical event or condition using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The start date of medical history event or condition represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month & year or year, etc.).
fields.label: Medical History Event Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MHSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MHSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the medical condition or event start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHENDAT

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Date/Time of Medical History Event

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the medical event or condition using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The end date of medical history event or condition represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (month & year or year, etc.).
fields.label: Medical History Event End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MHENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MHENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the medical condition or event end date?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the anatomical location of the medical event or condition.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the medical condition or event.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for skin rash). Could be a defaulted or hidden field on the CRF for pre-specified [MHTERM/Event Topic]. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Medical History Event Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the medical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Medical History Event Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the medical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Medical History Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHPORTOT

self.title: Medical History Event Location Portion or Totality

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location of the medical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Medical History Event Location Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHPORTOT
fields.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the of the medical condition or event?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHMODIFY

fields.definition: If the value for MHTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then MHMODIFY will contain the modified text.
fields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.
fields.label: Medical History Event Modified Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: MHMODIFY
fields.questionText: N/A

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHDECOD

fields.definition: The dictionary text description of MHTERM or the modified topic variable (MH MODIFY), if applicable.
fields.implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).
fields.label: Medical History Event Dictionary-Derived/Standardized Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
fields.name: MHDECOD
fields.questionText: N/A

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field MH.MHSOCCD

self.title: Medical History Event Primary System Organ Class Code

fields.definition: MedDRA Dictionary code for the primary System Organ Class.
fields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary.
fields.label: Medical History Event Primary System Organ Class Code
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
fields.name: MHSOCCD
fields.questionText: N/A
